newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Asian dollar deposits little changed in late trade.
newsitem.headline: Asian dollar deposits little changed in late trade.

text.p: Asian dollar deposit rates were little changed in featureless trade with most traders sidelined due mainly to an absence of fresh incentives, dealers said on Wednesday.

"The market was quiet and featureless in the morning on lack of fresh factors. Basically, the market is now waiting for Thursday's issue of the weekly jobless claims figures and Friday's release of the producer price index and retail sales index for March for fresh clues to market direction," a local dealer said.
In day-to-day rates, Wednesday/Thursday was unchanged from Tuesday's 5-11/16 5-9/16 percent.
Thursday/Friday and week-fixed eased 1/16 percentage point each to a common 5-5/8 5-1/2 percent, respectively.

Among term rates, one-month was unchanged at 5-11/16 5-9/16 percent, three-months unchanged at 5-13/16 5-11/16, nine-months unchanged at 6-3/16 6-1/16 and twelve-months unchanged at 6-5/16 6-3/16 percent.
